title.value: E3Bind: An End-to-End Equivariant Network for Protein-Ligand Docking
title.justification: This title captures the core contribution of the paper, which is presenting the E3Bind model.
title.quote: E3Bind: An End-to-End Equivariant Network for Protein-Ligand Docking

extractions.description: The paper introduces E3Bind, an end-to-end equivariant network designed for the flexible blind self-docking of ligands into protein binding pockets. E3Bind uses geometric constraints and local context to iteratively update ligand positions, orientations, and conformations. The model, which draws inspiration from AlphaFold2, outperforms traditional physics-based and recent deep learning methods in efficiency and accuracy for predicting ligand poses.

type.justification: The paper presents experimental results comparing the performance of the E3Bind model with other traditional and deep learning methods. It also provides a detailed evaluation of the model's performance across different metrics.
type.quote: Experiments on standard benchmark datasets demonstrate the superior performance of our end-to-end trainable model compared to traditional and recently-proposed deep learning methods.

name.justification: The primary focus is on protein-ligand docking, which is a key problem in computational biology and drug discovery.
name.quote: In silico prediction of the ligand binding pose to a given protein target is a crucial but challenging task in drug discovery.

name.justification: The application domain involves predicting docking poses of ligands for drug discovery purposes.
name.quote: In silico prediction of the ligand binding pose to a given protein target is a crucial but challenging task in drug discovery.

name.justification: The paper employs geometric constraints and equivariance, which are central themes in geometric deep learning.
name.quote: We propose E3Bind, an end-to-end equivariant network that iteratively updates the ligand pose.

name.justification: The main model proposed in the paper is E3Bind.
name.quote: We propose E3Bind, an end-to-end equivariant network that iteratively updates the ligand pose.

is_contributed.justification: The model E3Bind is introduced and developed by the authors in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: In this paper, we propose E3Bind, an end-to-end equivariant network that iteratively updates the ligand pose.

is_executed.justification: The paper presents empirical evaluations, which implies that the model was executed.
is_executed.quote: Empirical experiments show that E3Bind is competitive against state-of-the-art blind docking methods.

is_compared.justification: The performance of E3Bind is compared against other models like TankBind, EquiBind, and traditional methods.
is_compared.quote: Experiments on standard benchmark datasets demonstrate the superior performance of our end-to-end trainable model compared to traditional and recently-proposed deep learning methods.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The model E3Bind is originally introduced in this paper and does not refer to a previously published paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We propose E3Bind, an end-to-end equivariant network that iteratively updates the ligand pose.

name.justification: EquiBind is a baseline model to which E3Bind is compared.
name.quote: Recently, Stärk et al. (2022) proposed EquiBind, an equivariant model that directly predicts the coordinates of the docked pose.

is_contributed.justification: The model EquiBind was not developed by the authors of this paper.
is_contributed.quote: Recently, Stärk et al. (2022) proposed EquiBind, an equivariant model that directly predicts the coordinates of the docked pose.

is_executed.justification: EquiBind is used for comparison in the empirical studies presented in the paper.
is_executed.quote: Quantitative results show that E3Bind outperforms both traditional score-based methods and recent deep learning models including EquiBind.

is_compared.justification: EquiBind is compared to E3Bind in the paper.
is_compared.quote: Quantitative results show that E3Bind outperforms both traditional score-based methods and recent deep learning models including EquiBind.

referenced_paper_title.value: EquiBind: Geometric Deep Learning for Drug Binding Structure Prediction
referenced_paper_title.quote: Recently, Stärk et al. (2022) proposed EquiBind, an equivariant model that directly predicts the coordinates of the docked pose.

name.justification: TankBind is a baseline model to which E3Bind is compared.
name.quote: TankBind (Lu et al., 2022) drops the burden of conformation sampling by predicting the proteinligand distance map, then converting the distance map to a docked pose using gradient descent.

is_contributed.justification: The model TankBind was not developed by the authors of this paper.
is_contributed.quote: TankBind (Lu et al., 2022) drops the burden of conformation sampling by predicting the proteinligand distance map, then converting the distance map to a docked pose using gradient descent.

is_executed.justification: TankBind is used for comparison in the empirical studies presented in the paper.
is_executed.quote: Quantitative results show that E3Bind outperforms both traditional score-based methods and recent deep learning models including TankBind.

is_compared.justification: TankBind is compared to E3Bind in the paper.
is_compared.quote: Quantitative results show that E3Bind outperforms both traditional score-based methods and recent deep learning models including TankBind.

referenced_paper_title.value: TankBind: Trigonometry-Aware Neural Networks for Drug-Protein Binding Structure Prediction
referenced_paper_title.quote: TankBind (Lu et al., 2022) drops the burden of conformation sampling by predicting the proteinligand distance map, then converting the distance map to a docked pose using gradient descent.

name.justification: AlphaFold2 serves as an inspiration for the development of E3Bind.
name.quote: Inspired by the resounding success of AlphaFold2 for protein structure prediction, we propose E3Bind, an end-to-end equivariant network that iteratively updates the ligand pose.

is_contributed.justification: AlphaFold2 is an existing model used as inspiration and reference.
is_contributed.quote: Inspired by the resounding success of AlphaFold2 for protein structure prediction, we propose E3Bind, an end-to-end equivariant network that iteratively updates the ligand pose.

is_executed.justification: AlphaFold2 is cited as an inspiration but was not executed as part of the experiments.
is_executed.quote: Inspired by the resounding success of AlphaFold2 for protein structure prediction, we propose E3Bind, an end-to-end equivariant network that iteratively updates the ligand pose.

is_compared.justification: AlphaFold2 is cited as an inspiration but is not numerically compared in the paper.
is_compared.quote: Inspired by the resounding success of AlphaFold2 for protein structure prediction, we propose E3Bind, an end-to-end equivariant network that iteratively updates the ligand pose.

referenced_paper_title.value: Highly accurate protein structure prediction with AlphaFold
referenced_paper_title.quote: Inspired by the resounding success of AlphaFold2 for protein structure prediction, we propose E3Bind, an end-to-end equivariant network that iteratively updates the ligand pose.

name.justification: PDBbind v2020 is the dataset used for training and evaluation in this paper.
name.quote: We use the PDBbind v2020 dataset (Liu et al., 2017) for training and evaluation.

referenced_paper_title.value: Forging the Basis for Developing Protein–Ligand Interaction Scoring Functions
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper discusses the PDBbind dataset.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We use the PDBbind v2020 dataset (Liu et al., 2017) for training and evaluation.
